explanation: The original print line unconditionally added 1 to A // B, causing an off-by-one when A is divisible by B. The correct answer is the ceiling of A/B. I replaced the line with the standard integer-ceiling formula (A + B - 1) // B which yields the minimal number of attacks. (No retrieved diff directly applied to this bug; the fix uses the usual ceiling trick.)
fixed_code:
A, B = map(int, input().split())

print((A + B - 1) // B)
